SEARCH
Package de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.configstuff.advanced.modules

Klasse ValidationModule

java.lang.Object
de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.configstuff.advanced.modules.AbstractBaseConfigModule
de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.configstuff.advanced.modules.ValidationModule
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
BaseConfigModule
public class ValidationModule extends AbstractBaseConfigModule

Configuration validation module that enforces custom validation rules on configuration values in real-time. Automatically validates values when they are set and maintains error tracking for failed validations.

This module provides:

  • Real-time validation of configuration values as they are modified
  • Custom validation rule definition and management
  • Error tracking and reporting for failed validations
  • Event-driven validation triggered by configuration changes
  • Support for multiple validation rules per configuration key

 ValidationModule validator = new ValidationModule();
 config.registerModule(validator);

 // Add validation rules
 validator.addRule("server.port", new RangeValidationRule(1, 65535));
 validator.addRule("database.host", new NonEmptyStringValidationRule());

 // Values are automatically validated when set
 config.set("server.port", 8080); // Valid
 config.set("server.port", 70000); // Invalid - will be tracked as error

  • Methodendetails

    • onInitialize

      protected void onInitialize()
      Beschreibung aus Klasse kopiert: AbstractBaseConfigModule

      Abstract method called during module initialization. Subclasses must implement this method to perform their specific initialization logic.

      This method is called automatically by the initialize method and should not be called directly. Any exceptions thrown will cause the module to enter ERROR state.

      Angegeben von:
      onInitialize in Klasse AbstractBaseConfigModule

      This method is called automatically by the enable method and should not be called directly. Any exceptions thrown will cause the module to enter ERROR state.

      Beschreibung aus Klasse kopiert: AbstractBaseConfigModule

      Abstract method called during module disabling. Subclasses must implement this method to perform their specific disabling logic such as stopping background tasks or unregistering event listeners.

      This method is called automatically by the disable method and should not be called directly. Any exceptions thrown will cause the module to enter ERROR state.

      Angegeben von:
      onDisable in Klasse AbstractBaseConfigModule

    • onCleanup

      protected void onCleanup()
      Beschreibung aus Klasse kopiert: AbstractBaseConfigModule

      Abstract method called during module cleanup. Subclasses must implement this method to perform their specific cleanup logic such as releasing resources or clearing internal state.

      This method is called automatically by the cleanup method after all event listeners have been unregistered. Any exceptions thrown will cause the module to enter ERROR state.

      Angegeben von:
      onCleanup in Klasse AbstractBaseConfigModule

    • validateValue

      public boolean validateValue(String key, Object value)

      Validates a configuration value against all registered rules for the specified key.

      
 boolean isValid = validator.validateValue("server.port", 8080);
 if (!isValid) {
     String error = validator.getErrors().get("server.port");
     System.out.println("Validation failed: " + error);
 }
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to validate
      value - the value to validate against the rules
      Gibt zurück:
      true if validation passes, false if any rule fails

    • addRule

      public void addRule(String key, ValidationModule.ValidationRule rule)

      Adds a validation rule for a specific configuration key. If the key already has a value, it will be immediately validated against the new rule.

      
 ValidationRule portRule = new RangeValidationRule(1, 65535);
 validator.addRule("server.port", portRule);

 ValidationRule hostRule = new NonEmptyStringValidationRule();
 validator.addRule("database.host", hostRule);
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to apply the rule to
      rule - the validation rule to add

    • removeRule

      public void removeRule(String key)

      Removes all validation rules for the specified configuration key and clears any associated errors.

      
 validator.removeRule("server.port");
 // All rules for server.port are now removed
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to remove rules from

    • hasRule

      public boolean hasRule(String key)

      Checks if any validation rules are registered for the specified configuration key.

      
 if (validator.hasRule("server.port")) {
     System.out.println("Port validation is active");
 }
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to check
      Gibt zurück:
      true if at least one rule is registered for the key, false otherwise

    • getErrors

      public Map<String,String> getErrors()

      Gets a copy of all current validation errors. The map contains configuration keys mapped to their respective error messages.

      
 Map<String, String> errors = validator.getErrors();
 for (Map.Entry<String, String> entry : errors.entrySet()) {
     System.out.println(entry.getKey() + ": " + entry.getValue());
 }
      Gibt zurück:
      a new map containing all current validation errors

    • hasErrors

      public boolean hasErrors()

      Checks if there are any current validation errors.

      
 if (validator.hasErrors()) {
     System.out.println("Configuration has validation errors");
     Map<String, String> errors = validator.getErrors();
     // Handle errors
 }
      Gibt zurück:
      true if there are validation errors, false otherwise

    • getRules

      public List<ValidationModule.ValidationRule> getRules(String key)

      Gets all validation rules registered for a specific configuration key.

      
 List<ValidationRule> portRules = validator.getRules("server.port");
 System.out.println("Port has " + portRules.size() + " validation rules");
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to get rules for
      Gibt zurück:
      a list of validation rules for the key, or empty list if none exist

    • validateAll

      public boolean validateAll()

      Validates all currently registered configuration keys against their rules and updates the error tracking accordingly.

      
 validator.validateAll();
 if (validator.hasErrors()) {
     System.out.println("Some configuration values are invalid");
 }
      Gibt zurück:
      true if all validations pass, false if any validation fails

    • clearErrors

      public void clearErrors()

      Clears all validation errors without removing the validation rules themselves.

      
 validator.clearErrors();
 // All error tracking is reset, but rules remain active

    • getError

      public String getError(String key)

      Gets the specific error message for a configuration key, if any exists.

      
 String portError = validator.getError("server.port");
 if (portError != null) {
     System.out.println("Port validation error: " + portError);
 }
      Parameter:
      key - the configuration key to get the error for
      Gibt zurück:
      the error message if validation failed, null if no error exists

    • addStringValidator

      public void addStringValidator(String path, Object validator)

      Adds a string validation rule for a configuration key. The validator can be a regex pattern or a custom predicate function.

      
 validator.addStringValidator("username", "^[a-zA-Z0-9_]{3,16}$");
 // or using a predicate
 validator.addStringValidator("username", value -> value != null && !value.toString().isEmpty());
      Parameter:
      path - the configuration key to apply the validation to
      validator - the validation rule as a String pattern or Predicate function

    • addValidator

      public <T> void addValidator(String path, Class<T> type, ValidationModule.Validator<T> validator)

    • addPatternValidator

      public void addPatternValidator(String path, String pattern)

    • getAdditionalModuleState

      protected Map<String,Object> getAdditionalModuleState()
      Beschreibung aus Klasse kopiert: AbstractBaseConfigModule

      Abstract method that allows subclasses to provide additional state information to be included in the module state snapshot. This method is called by getModuleState to collect any module-specific state data.

      Subclasses should override this method to provide relevant state information such as configuration values, statistics, or operational status.

      
 protected Map<String, Object> getAdditionalModuleState() {
     Map<String, Object> state = new HashMap<>();
     state.put("processedCount", processedEventCount);
     state.put("lastProcessed", lastProcessedTime);
     return state;
 }
      Angegeben von:
      getAdditionalModuleState in Klasse AbstractBaseConfigModule
      Gibt zurück:
      a map of additional state information, or null if no additional state

    • validateAllValues

      public void validateAllValues()

    • getValidatedKeyCount

      public int getValidatedKeyCount()

      Gets the total number of configuration keys that have validation rules.

      
 int validatedKeys = validator.getValidatedKeyCount();
 System.out.println("Validating " + validatedKeys + " configuration keys");
      Gibt zurück:
      the number of keys with at least one validation rule

    • getValidatedKeys

      public List<String> getValidatedKeys()

      Gets all configuration keys that currently have validation rules registered.

      
 List<String> validatedKeys = validator.getValidatedKeys();
 for (String key : validatedKeys) {
     System.out.println("Key with validation: " + key);
 }
      Gibt zurück:
      a list of all keys that have validation rules
